subject: Re: [junit] Problems migrating from JUnit3.7 to 3.8.1
msgSnippet: ... JUnit doesn t need Ant at all (unless you want to build JUnit from sources), so there certainly is no note with JUnit. To run Ant s  task with JUnit
messageBody:
On Thu, 19 Sep 2002, Paul Michali <pcm@...> wrote:

> I didn't see anything where JUnit3.8.1 said that it needed Ant1.5 or
> newer. I must have missed it.

JUnit doesn't need Ant at all (unless you want to build JUnit from
sources), so there certainly is no note with JUnit.

To run Ant's <junit> task with JUnit 3.8*, you need Ant 1.5 as Ant
1.4.1 and earlier use TestCase#name which has been deprecated in JUnit
3.7 and removed in JUnit 3.8.

> Is there any advantage/disadvantage to moving to JDK1.4 with these
> versions of Ant and JUnit?

As far as Ant is concerned, if you use Windows XP, you are a lot
better of with upgrading to Ant 1.5 at the same time. No known JDK1.4
problems in Ant 1.5 I was aware of.

Stefan
